metadata.title: CVE-2018-16074 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in site isolation in Google Chrome prior to69.0.3497.81 allowed a remote attacker to bypass site isolation via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16074` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '69.0.3497.81-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
